edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll

  • public class CourseRoll
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to handle the course roll for a given Course and keep track of enrolled Students and add/remove Students from the Course. Each CourseRoll knows what Course it is keeping track of for its roll and its waitlist.
    Author:
    mlee25 Michael Lee

      Constructor for CourseRoll.

      Method to check if a Student can be enrolled in a Course.
      void drop(Student s)
      If a Student is on the main CourseRoll list, removes the Student from the CourseRoll, and the student at the front of the waitlist queue is added to the CourseRoll.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CourseRoll

        public CourseRoll(Course course,
                  int x)
        Constructor for CourseRoll. Creates an empty LinkedAbstractList of Students.
        Parameters:
        course - the Course associated with this CourseRoll
        x - the initial enrollment capacity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCap is less than MIN_ENROLLMENT or greater than MAX_ENROLLMENT.

    • Method Detail

      • getEnrollmentCap

        public int getEnrollmentCap()
        Getter for enrollmentCap.
        Returns:
        the enrollmentCap

      • setEnrollmentCap

        public void setEnrollmentCap(int x)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Setter for enrollmentCap. enrollmentCap can be changed for an existing CourseRoll if the new enrollmentCap is not less than the number of currently enrolled students.
        Parameters:
        x - the enrollmentCap to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCap is less than MIN_ENROLLMENT or greater than MAX_ENROLLMENT

      • enroll

        public void enroll(Student s)
        Enroll a Student in the Course and adds them to the end of the CourseRoll list. If the courseroll is at capacity, the Student is added to the waitlist. If the waitlist is full, the Student cannot enroll and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Parameters:
        s - the Student to enroll
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Student is null, there is no more room on the waitlist, the Student is already enrolled, or if adding the Student to the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception

      • drop

        public void drop(Student s)
        If a Student is on the main CourseRoll list, removes the Student from the CourseRoll, and the student at the front of the waitlist queue is added to the CourseRoll. If a Student is on the waitlist queue, removes the Student from the waitlist.
        Parameters:
        s - the Student to drop
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Student is null or if removing the Student from the LinkedAbstractList generates an exception

      • getOpenSeats

        public int getOpenSeats()
        Getter for the number of open seats.
        Returns:
        the difference between enrollmentCap and the current size of the CourseRoll roll

      • getNumberOnWaitlist

        public int getNumberOnWaitlist()
        Getter for the number of students on the waitlist.
        Returns:
        the current size of the waitlist

      • canEnroll

        public boolean canEnroll(Student student)
        Method to check if a Student can be enrolled in a Course.
        Parameters:
        student - the Student to check
        Returns:
        true if the Student can be added or false if there is no more room in the Course or the Student is already enrolled.
